clauses.text: The purpose of these Regulations is to: define the purpose and functions of the Academic Boarda. make provision for the membership of the Academic Boardb. make provision for the appointment of the Chair and Deputy Chair of Academic Board; andc. provide for meetings of the Academic Board.d.
The Academic Board is required to be established by Council pursuant to section 20 of the Royal Melbourne Institute of Technology Act 2010 .
The functions of the Academic Board are established under Part 4 of the RMIT Statute No. 1 (Amendment No. 2).
These Regulations are made pursuant to sections 28, 29 and 30 of the Royal Melbourne Institute of Technology Act 2010 and Part 4 of the RMIT Statute No. 1 (Amendment No. 2) .

An elected member: holds office for a period of two (2) years except that student members will hold office for a term of one (1) year,a. and assumes office on the first day of January following the member’s election unless the member is replacing ab. vacancy under clauses (14), (15) or (16), in which case the elected member may assume office at the next meeting.

Where a member of the Academic Board: elected by staff ceases to be a member of staff, ora. elected by enrolled students, ceases to be an enrolled student,b. that member ceases to be a member of the Academic Board and the vacancy thereby created is a casual vacancy.
Any vacancy created in the membership of the Academic Board is dealt with in accordance with the provisions of the Elections Regulations .

All elections to the Academic Board must be conducted in accordance with the Statute and Elections Regulations, unless otherwise specified.
The Board shall in every second calendar year elect from amongst its members a Chair and Deputy Chair who will hold office for a period of two (2) years.
The Chair and Deputy Chair must be a senior academic or senior educator in accordance with the definitions provided under regulation 3(1).
A person may not serve as Chair or Deputy Chair while they are: an ex-officio member of the Academic Board, ora. a Head of School, Dean or Executive Dean of a University school.b.

A call for nominations to members of the Academic Board for the position of Chair and Deputy Chair is made by the Board secretary not less than ten (10) working days prior to the first day of the ballot period.
Nominations for the position of Chair and Deputy Chair may be submitted by a date set by the Board secretary no later than one (1) working day prior to the first day of the ballot period.
If more than one nomination is received for each position, the Board secretary will conduct an election for that position.

The Board secretary, not later than five (5) working days prior to the last day of the ballot period, notifies members of the Academic Board of: the nominations received, anda. the process for voting (by secret ballot)b.
Where the Chair of the Academic Board is absent from the University the Deputy Chair will preside and assume all functions and duties of the Chair.
If the Deputy Chair is required to act as Chair but is unavailable or unable to do so, the Council may by resolution appoint an interim Acting Chair for a specified period.
The Chair or Deputy Chair positions will become vacant if the occupant: resigns from their office bearer position.a.
If the office of Chair becomes vacant on or after the last six months of the Chair’s term, the vacancy must be filled by the Deputy Chair.
If the Deputy Chair is required to act as Chair but is unavailable or unable to do so, the Council may by resolution appoint a Chair for the remainder of the term.

If the office of Chair becomes vacant before the last six months of the Chair’s term, a new Chair must be elected as soon as possible in accordance with the office bearer election provisions of these regulations. qa_index.text: The Board shall in every second calendar year elect from amongst its members a Chair and Deputy Chair who will hold office for a period of two (2) years. The Chair and Deputy Chair must be a senior academic or senior educator in accordance with the definitions provided under regulation 3(1). A person may not serve as Chair or Deputy Chair while they are: an ex-officio member of the Academic Board, ora. a Head of School, Dean or Executive Dean of a University school.b. A call for nominations to members of the Academic Board for the position of Chair and Deputy Chair is made by the Board secretary not less than ten (10) working days prior to the first day of the ballot period. Nominations for the position of Chair and Deputy Chair may be submitted by a date set by the Board secretary no later than one (1) working day prior to the first day of the ballot period. If more than one nomination is received for each position, the Board secretary will conduct an election for that position. The Board secretary, not later than five (5) working days prior to the last day of the ballot period, notifies members of the Academic Board of: the nominations received, anda. the process for voting (by secret ballot)b. Where the Chair of the Academic Board is absent from the University the Deputy Chair will preside and assume all functions and duties of the Chair. If the Deputy Chair is required to act as Chair but is unavailable or unable to do so, the Council may by resolution appoint an interim Acting Chair for a specified period. The Chair or Deputy Chair positions will become vacant if the occupant: resigns from their office bearer position.a. If the office of Chair becomes vacant on or after the last six months of the Chair’s term, the vacancy must be filled by the Deputy Chair. If the office of Chair becomes vacant before the last six months of the Chair’s term, a new Chair must be elected as soon as possible in accordance with the office bearer election provisions of these regulations.
